title: refactor: Use ScrollingViewBehavior for FAB
message:
refactor: Use ScrollingViewBehavior for FAB

When hiding and showing the FAB upon scroll, use the
ScrollingViewBehavior rather than set the event directly on the
recyclerView. This is cleaner and moves the code to the XML (plus
one extra Java class).

title: feat: Hide FAB when scrolling down and vice versa
message:
feat: Hide FAB when scrolling down and vice versa

When user is scrolling the items list the FAB should not get in the
way of the items.

title: fix: Searched items don't restore on tablet
message:
fix: Searched items don't restore on tablet

When doing a search on a tablet and then opening one of the searched
items, if the user presses back to return to the search list it clears the
results such that they have to enter the search term again.

title: refactor: Replace deprecated method
message: refactor: Replace deprecated method

title: fix: User is able to press back while editing
message:
fix: User is able to press back while editing

When an item is edited (even a new one) it is automatically saved.
If the user presses back during editing they may not be aware
that the item was already saved.

title: fix: Widget margins don't work correctly pre 24
message:
fix: Widget margins don't work correctly pre 24

On pre API 24, for some reason the margins don't work correctly
if set at the root level. Using child layouts resolves the issue.
Seems like a bug.

title: fix: Widget list divider not showing pre API 24
message: fix: Widget list divider not showing pre API 24

title: fix: Widget text not visible on pre API 24
message:
fix: Widget text not visible on pre API 24

For some reason "?android:attr/textColorPrimary" returns opposite
values (e.g. black vs white) depending on the API version. With a
white background on the widget the pre API 24 devices were showing
white text which is invisible.

index position since there's already something there.

However since it can take some time to get the items via firebase the
search can finish before the items come back; search doesn't wait for
getItems to finish.

null id in an actual item. The null id is for the activity/fragment
to indicate if there is an existing item. This can be null. But once
the item is created it should have an id.

title: fix: Two encrypted files with the same name
message:
fix: Two encrypted files with the same name

Travis can't handle two encrypted files with the same name even if
they're in different directories.

Since I can include both mock and prod in one google-services.json
file there's no need to have two.

title: test: Don't check package in intended
message:
test: Don't check package in intended

To make sure tests work across both prod and mock packages, don't
check the package and also instead use className over shortClassName.

Checking package only really makes sense for external calls.

title: chore: Use encrypted google-service over fake
message:
chore: Use encrypted google-service over fake

Instead of using fake google-services for mock, use a real one and
encrypt it with Travis. That way the app can still use Firebase when
in mock flavour.

title: chore: Add fake google-services plugin for Travis
message:
chore: Add fake google-services plugin for Travis

Firebase needs google-services.json however there is no way to use
the google-services plugin only for mock; it's all or nothing.

Using a fake google-services.json file in the mock flavour with no
API key seems to work ok so far. This way Travis is happy as gradle
will not complain, and with Travis only running mock tests it won't
need the real json file which is in prod.

title: test: Remove example test
message: test: Remove example test

title: chore: Remove google-services plugin
message:
chore: Remove google-services plugin

See previous commit message for more explanation.

title: fix: Travis breaks without google-services.json
message:
fix: Travis breaks without google-services.json

When using the Google services plugin it needs the
google-services.json file. However this file contains my API key so I
don't want to upload it to Github.

If I don't use the google-services plugin at all I can supply the API
key manually from a properties file. Since mock tests don't need the
API key I can have Travis only run MockDebug tests so I don't need to
store the API key on Github. Since Travis doesn't need to run prod
tests this should be an acceptable solution for now providing
everything still works. So far so good.
